channel.title: work stuff on Digital Forays
channel.description: Recent content in work stuff on Digital Forays

item.title: More _The Turn of the Screw_ Data Analysis
item.description: I know I mentioned in an earlier post—a couple of different posts actually (here and here too)—that I’ve been doing a bunch of work with Henry James’s canonical The Turn of the Screw. I thought I would post a little bit more here of what I’ve been up to as of late with this. A student of mine was fascinated by the use of the words “prodigious” and “portentous” in the Governess’s narrative in Turn.

item.title: Let's Do Some Real World HTML Table Parsing with Beautiful Soup
item.description: Given that I’m continuing to chronicle my DH journeys here, I figured I’d showcase a little bit of my utilization of scraping data from a website with Beautiful Soup (docs are here). Doing some research for a favorite student of mine, I’ve been wandering around websites devoted to law school. One website here has a really fantastic little table on the page that has everything one could want—especially if one is a little behind on deadlines and trying to catch up a bit (i.

item.title: Graduate-Level Course in Digital Rhetoric (Summer 2022)
item.description: After a few semesters of planning and learning, my Department is rolling out the sixth and final course in a slate of courses designed to get Illinois teachers ready and credentialed to teach dual-credit English composition courses in their high schools. This has been in partnership with my current institution’s College of Education, the “REAL Academy” and it has been quite a whirlwind road, lots of fun, lots of work, lots of opportunity for me to learn all kinds of new things.
